item.title: How New Game Plus Works In Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Are you curious about New Game Plus in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers? This mode is a staple in soulslike and role-playing games, letting you restart your adventure with the goodies that you've found during your first playthrough. That said, there are some caveats that might surprise you with how Wuchang handles this concept. Oh, and before we continue, please be reminded that this article contains minor spoilers.

What to expect in New Game Plus in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

New Game Plus mode is unlocked after completing the campaign and obtaining an ending. After the end credits roll, you'll be sent back to the main menu. Unfortunately, we're not allowed to show an image just yet, but you should see an option called "Causality Reversal," which is the term that the game uses for New Game Plus mode.

Should you start New Game Plus mode?

Here's the surprising part: You're actually forced to start Wuchang: Fallen Feathers' New Game Plus mode after beating the game.

It doesn't matter if you pick "Causality Reversal," "Continue," or "Load Game." All these options bring you back to the game's intro for a New Game Plus run. Worse, your original save file will be overwritten, too.

This can be a bit problematic, especially if you missed a few items or spells during your initial playthrough. It's also different from how other games handled this feature--i.e. there's an option to try New Game Plus via the main menu, but you can still load your original save.

Is there a way to avoid New Game Plus mode?

If you're not ready yet for New Game Plus in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, you need to have a backup save before you conclude the campaign. This is how we did our workaround for the PC (Steam) version of the game:

  • Prior to obtaining an ending, we exited the game so we could have a backup of the save state.
  • The files/folders that you need are in the "C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Local\Project_Plague" directory.
  • Copy the whole "Saved" folder and place it somewhere else.

If you need to revert to a previous state, simply place the "Saved" folder in the "Project_Plague" directory and overwrite everything there. Then, launch Wuchang and pick "Load Game" from the main menu.

The save file might say "Causality Reversal 1"--i.e. New Game +1--but that's fine. This is mostly due to cloud functionality. Upon loading it, you should find yourself at the same spot as your original save.

What carries over and what changes in New Game Plus?

Here's what you can expect in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers' New Game Plus mode:

  • You carry over all your equipment/gear pieces, Red Mercury, unlocked skills, spells, temperance needles, and the like.
  • Enemies will be tougher this time around.
  • Jade Pendants and Benedictions that you pick up have a +1 coefficient, which means their effects are more potent.
  • Vendors still sell the same items. You can't purchase stuff that can't have duplicates--i.e. spells.
  • If you loot items that can't have duplicates--i.e. Manna Vase upgrades and spells--you'll receive Red Mercury-related materials instead.
  • Panda Bamboozlings/Bamboo Shoots and Inner Demons that you killed before will respawn in the same locations. You should be able to amass more of their rewards.
  • You have to reacquire quest items. You can tackle quests that you weren't able to complete previously.

That does it for our guide on New Game Plus in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers. We hope you're well prepared if you want to continue your adventure. If you're still looking for other gear pieces, you can take a look at our best weapons and armors/outfits guide.

Many dangers await you as you venture forth in Sichuan Province during the fall of the Ming Dynasty. If you need more help, we've got you covered with our Wuchang: Fallen Feathers guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wuchang-fallen-feathers-new-game-plus-mode/1100-6533443/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Green Man Gaming's 2025 Summer Sale Is Now Live
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

We're nearing the end of July, and while that means the days are already getting shorter and Fall is nearing closer, we still have several weeks of summer--and that means many of us are looking for new games to play while we stay inside to avoid the heat. Luckily, Green Man Gaming's Summer Sale is now live, offering big discounts on thousands of PC games through August 8. Note that in order to get the best prices, you need to be a member of GMG's free GMG XP rewards program. Not only does the free program include bonus discounts, but you also earn points on purchases that unlock additional deals, free giveaways, and more.

We've combed through the sale and compiled a list of some of our favorite deals, which you'll find below. However, it's worth mentioning that there are select Featured Deals that include a free pack with extra coupon codes and other bonuses. Several big recent releases are part of the Featured Deal promotion, including the acclaimed turn-based RPG Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, which is down to $39.59 (normally $50). Red Dead Redemption II: Ultimate Edition, Indiana Jones And the Great Circle, Alan Wake II, and several other titles are also eligible for Green Man Gaming's Summer Sale Featured Deals promo. Here's the full list:

Green Man Gaming Summer Sale Featured Deals

  • Alan Wake II -- $18 ($50)
  • Back 4 Blood -- $5.28 ($60)
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 -- $39.59 ($50)
  • Grand Theft Auto V Enhanced -- 13.50 ($30)
  • Indiana Jones And the Great Circle -- $47.59 ($70)
  • NBA 2K25 -- $8.82 ($70)
  • Red Dead Redemption II: Ultimate Edition -- $18 ($100)
  • Sniper Elite Resistance -- $31.59 ($50)

Beyond these featured deals, you'll also find big discounts on plenty of other PC games right now. This includes recent arrivals like Patapon 1+2 Replay for $25.49 (was $30), Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Deluxe Edition for $48 (was $60), and Stellar Blade for $54 (was $60), plus price cuts on popular titles like Yakuza: Like A Dragon for $9 (was $20), the Deux Ex Collection for $7.49 (was $62), and Marvel's Midnight Suns: Legendary Edition for $18 (was $100).

You can even save on preorders during GMG's Summer Sale. Upcoming releases like Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, Borderlands 4, Digimon Time Stranger, and Sonic Racing Crossworlds are among the many discounted preorders. Be sure to check out the list below for even more of our favorite deals in the 2025 Green Man Gaming Summer Sale, or head over to the retailer's full site to browse the entire lineup. All games purchased from GMG are delivered as official keys. Most are redeemed via Steam, while others are for the Epic Game Store or other PC gaming storefronts. Each game's GMG store page lists which DRM the key requires.

Green Man Gaming Summer Sale

All prices listed include bonus GMG XP membership discounts.

  • BioShock: The Collection -- $10.80 ($60)
  • Borderlands 4 -- $61.52 ($70) | Releases September 12
  • Dave the Diver -- $16 ($20)
  • Deus Ex Collection -- $7.49 ($62)
  • Digimon Story: Time Stranger -- $63 ($70) | Releases October 2
  • Dragon's Dogma 2 -- $25.87 ($70)
  • Doom: The Dark Ages -- $58.09 ($70)
  • Elden Ring: Nightreign -- $36 ($40)

  • Horizon Forbidden West: Complete Edition -- $52.79 ($60)
  • Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga -- $8.80 ($50)
  • Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy -- $7.20 ($60)
  • Marvel's Midnight Suns Legendary Edition -- $18 ($100)
  • Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater - Digital Deluxe Edition -- $64 ($80) | Releases August 26
  • Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor GOTY Edition -- $3.12 ($20)
  • Middle-earth: Shadow of War -- $5.85 ($50)
  • Patapon 1+2 Replay -- $25.49 ($30)
  • Remnant 2 -- $17 ($50)
  • Resident Evil 4 Gold Edition -- $26.39 ($50)
  • Rise of the Tomb Raider: 20 Year Celebration -- $3.83 ($30)
  • Shadow of the Tomb Raider Definitive Edition -- $6.80 ($40)
  • Silent Hill f -- $54.59 ($70) | Releases September 25
  • Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds -- $60.89 ($70) | Releases September 25
  • Stellar Blade: Complete Edition -- $72 ($80)
  • Thief: Master Thief Edition -- $3 ($25)

  • Yakuza: Like a Dragon -- $9 ($60)
